page.title: 01GOSBERTON, LINCS FENLAND
page.content: This area is almost entirely intensively cultivated arable farmland. Crops grown are potatoes, wheat, sugar beet, onions and horticulural crops such as cauliflowers, lettuce, greens, also some flower bulbs (daffodils and tulips). The land is very flat and extensively drained. Most of the farms are quite small, 50 to 100 acres. To the West is part of the village of Gosberton, near the road junction is the Primary School, five to eleven year old attend this school, roll 140, there is also a small park which is used as a recreational area for the school and village. There has been a considerable number of new houses built in Gosberton during the past 10 years. There is a home for the elderly, Bank House, which has about forty residents.
